TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit HealthRecordInfo extends Microsoft.Health.HealthRecordAccessor implements class Microsoft.Health.IMarshallable

Docs.summary: Represents the APIs and information about a health record for an individual.
Docs.remarks: A HealthRecordInfo represents a person's view of a health record and information about the health record such as the state, name, date of expiration, and so on. This view may vary based upon the access rights the person has to the record and multiple people may have access to the same record but have different views. For instance, a husband may have a HealthRecordInfo instance for himself and another for his wife's health record which she shared with him.

MemberSignature.Value: public DateTime DateAuthorizationExpires { get; protected set; }
.property instance valuetype System.DateTime DateAuthorizationExpires

Docs.summary: Gets the date/time that the authorization for the record expires.
Docs.value: A DateTime in UTC indicating when the record is no longer accessible to the user.
Docs.remarks: When a person shares their record with another HealthVault account, they can specify the date when that sharing is revoked (if ever). This property indicates that date. If the person tries to access the record after the indicated date, they receive a .
Docs.exception: The record was constructed using the record ID and has not been called.

.property instance valuetype System.DateTime DateCreated

Docs.summary: Gets the date the record was created, in UTC.
Docs.remarks: To be added.

.property instance valuetype System.DateTime DateUpdated

Docs.summary: Gets the date the record was updated, in UTC.
Docs.remarks: To be added.

MemberSignature.Value: public string DisplayName { get; protected set; }
.property instance string DisplayName

Docs.summary: Gets the display name of the record.
Docs.value: A string representing the name of the record as seen by the current user.
Docs.remarks: A record has a name that defaults to the name of the owner of the record. A nickname can override the record name for each person authorized to use the record. If the nickname is specified, it is returned in this property. If the nickname is not specified, the record name is returned.
Docs.exception: The record was constructed using the record ID and has not been called.

MemberSignature.Value: public Microsoft.Health.HealthRecordAuthorizationStatus HealthRecordAuthorizationStatus { get; protected set; }
.property instance valuetype Microsoft.Health.HealthRecordAuthorizationStatus HealthRecordAuthorizationStatus

Docs.summary: Gets the for the record.
Docs.remarks: The status indicates whether, at the time of retrieval, the application is able to access the record. Any status other than NoActionRequired requires user intervention in HealthVault before the application may successfully access the record.

MemberSignature.Value: public bool IsCustodian { get; protected set; }
.property instance bool IsCustodian

Docs.summary: Gets a value indicating whether or not the person is a custodian of the record.
Docs.value: true if the person is a custodian of the record; otherwise, false.
Docs.remarks: A person is considered a custodian if they have been given ownership of the record. The owner can give ownership to another as an explicit action when sharing the record.
Docs.exception: The record was constructed using the record ID and has not been called.

MemberSignature.Value: public long LatestOperationSequenceNumber { get; protected set; }
.property instance int64 LatestOperationSequenceNumber

Docs.summary: Gets the record's latest operation sequence number.
Docs.remarks: The record's operation sequence number is used when sync'ing data from a record. Anytime an operation is performed against a health record item HealthVault stamps it with the next increment of the operation sequence number for the record. For example, the first item added to the record would be stamped with the sequence number 1, the next operation would stamp the thing with 2, etc. Applications can determine all operations that have occurred since a known point by calling GetRecordOperations and passing the sequence number of the known point.

Docs.remarks: The name defaults to the name of the person to whom the record belongs. See for how to override the name to customize the view for a person authorized to view the record.
